result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendall Aaron Preuss

records.addlTxt:
3:29 PM Defendant Kendall Aaron Preuss in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Kendall Aaron Preuss.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed.

Atty Gumz states why the defendant failed to appear yesterday.  Defendant states the reason why.
BY THE COURT:  Signature bond will be reinstated
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Kendall Aaron Preuss not in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Kendall Aaron Preuss.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR511 tracking with 22CF55:
Atty Gumz is unsure why his client isn't here today, he did speak with him last week on the matter.
Atty Burdon requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
Defendant will need to appear in person to quash the warrant.

2:54 PM Defendant Kendall Aaron Preuss appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Kendall Aaron Preuss.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is having some issues with his phone.  Court notes that he did speak to him earlier but now he cannot unmute.  Atty Gumz has been texting him.

Atty Gumz asks that as Preliminary Hearing be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kendall Aaron Preuss appeared by phone.  Attorney Rachel Roberge appeared by video for Kendall Aaron Preuss. 
22TR511 tracking with 22CF55:
Atty Roberge asks for another status date.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:13 AM Defendant Kendall Aaron Preuss appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by phone for Kendall Aaron Preuss.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR000511 tracking with 22CF55:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on the traffic ticket

Atty Gumz waives time limits.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:15 PM Defendant Kendall Aaron Preuss appeared by video.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Atty Gumz doesn't have the complaint yet and has not done an appointment check yet; he anticipates representing the defendant but asks that the IA be set out.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon has no objection to a signature bond with conditions. 
Atty Gumz does not object.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
